item.title: 澳大利亚传唤新加坡电信，致命停机事故的处罚迫在眉睫
item.description: 澳大利亚通信部长阿尼卡-韦尔斯（Anika Wells）在新加坡电信有限公司（Singapore Telecommunications Ltd.）Optus 分部发生致命故障后召见了该公司，警告称这一失误可能导致重大经济处罚。【原文：Australian Communications Minister Anika Wells summoned Singapore Telecommunications Ltd. to a meeting following a fatal outage at its Optus division, warning the blunder was likely to lead to major financial penalties.】

item.title: 美元走软可能导致亚洲新兴市场对冲需求增加
item.description: 在亚洲，保护美元风险敞口的成本是 4 月份以来最低的，并有望进一步下降，这为需要套期保值的投资者创造了机会。【原文：The cost of protecting dollar exposures in Asia is the lowest since April and poised to decline further, creating an opportunity for investors who need to hedge.】

item.title: 愤怒的 "Z世代 "孩子如何引发了今年亚洲最严重的抗议活动
item.description:
尼泊尔的灾难给那些因失业和腐败问题而恼火的年轻人敲响了警钟。【原文：

Nepal’s wreckage serves as a warning to leaders ruling over young populations seething over unemployment and corruption.

】

item.title: 世界第二大铜矿事故引发市场疲软
item.description: 自由港麦克莫兰公司（Freeport-McMoRan Inc.【原文：Freeport-McMoRan Inc.’s declaration of force majeure at its Grasberg mine in Indonesia — where two employees are dead and five missing after a massive mud flow — couldn’t have come at a worse time for the global copper market.】

item.title: 中国债券供应将在年底前减少，缓解市场压力
item.description: 中国政府债券的发行量将在年底前大幅下降，这将缓解市场因股票轮动而承受的压力。【原文：Chinese government bond issuance is set to plunge by year-end, offering relief to a market also pressured by a rotation into equities.】

item.title: 石油因特朗普鹰派通俄言论而跳涨后趋于平稳
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对俄罗斯的鹰派言论愈演愈烈，引发地缘政治风险之后，石油价格在创下 7 月份以来最大涨幅之后趋于稳定。【原文：Oil steadied following its biggest jump since July, after US President Donald Trump’s increasingly hawkish rhetoric on Russia raised geopolitical risk.】

item.title: 汇丰称通过新量子试验击败华尔街竞争对手
item.description: 汇丰控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）表示，该公司在金融市场部署量子计算方面取得了世界首例突破，华尔街一些最大的公司正在加紧争夺将这项尖端技术嵌入其日常运营中。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc said it’s achieved a world-first breakthrough in deploying quantum computing in financial markets, as a race intensifies among some of Wall Street’s biggest firms to embed the cutting-edge technology in their daily operations.】

item.title: 中国最大的汽车出口商奇瑞汽车将在香港首次亮相
item.description: 中国最大的汽车出口商奇瑞汽车股份有限公司（Chery Automobile Co.【原文：Chery Automobile Co., China’s biggest car exporter, will start trading in Hong Kong Thursday after raising HK$9.1 billion ($1.2 billion) in an initial public offering to help power its overseas expansion ambition.】

item.title: 特朗普在乌克兰问题上的新转变让欧洲感到束手无策
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普对基辅抗击俄罗斯入侵战争的前景持乐观态度，乌克兰及其盟国正沉浸在特朗普的惊喜之中，有迹象表明美国总统正在采取一个熟悉的举动：不是对俄罗斯，而是对欧洲施加更大的压力。【原文：As Ukraine and its allies absorbed the surprise from Donald Trump’s newly upbeat view of Kyiv’s prospects in its war against Russia’s invasion, there were signs of a familiar move by the US president — upping the pressure not on Russia but on Europe.】

item.title: 加拿大与印尼在美国关税动荡中签署贸易协议
item.description: 印度尼西亚和加拿大同意达成一项降低贸易壁垒和放宽投资程序的协议，这是两国在美国提高关税之后为扩大全球经济联系所做努力的一部分。【原文：Indonesia and Canada agreed to a deal to lower trade barriers and ease investment procedures, part of efforts by both nations to expand global economic ties in the wake of higher US tariffs.】

item.title: 全球涨势停滞，亚洲股市将下跌：市场综述
item.description: 随着人工智能推动的股市上涨逐渐出现疲态，亚洲股市周四将追随华尔街的跌势而下滑。【原文：Asian stocks were set to slip Thursday, tracking losses on Wall Street as signs of fatigue crept into the AI-fueled equity rally.】

item.title: 凯雷投资的 Orion 啤酒公司将在东京证券交易所上市
item.description: Orion Breweries Ltd. 首次公开募股规模扩大后，将于本周四在东京证券交易所上市交易。【原文：Orion Breweries Ltd. is set to trade on the Tokyo Stock Exchange on Thursday after the size of its initial public offering was increased.】

item.title: 叙利亚领导人在联合国呼吁国际社会帮助重建四分五裂的国家
item.description: 叙利亚总统首次登上国际舞台，这是半个多世纪以来叙利亚领导人首次在联合国大会上发表讲话。【原文：Syria’s president made his debut on the international stage with the first address by a leader from his country to the United Nations General Assembly in more than half a century.】

item.title: 美国生命线颠覆空头押注，贝森特止损阿根廷危机
item.description: 投机者试图从阿根廷市场的大跌中获利，却被一个愿意站在交易对立面的强大投资者--美国政府--拦住了去路。【原文：Speculators seeking to profit from the selloffs racing through Argentina’s markets were stopped dead in their tracks by a powerful investor willing to take the opposite side of the trade: The US government.】

item.title: 财政和债务前景改善，哥斯达黎加获穆迪评级上调
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）上调了哥斯达黎加的信用评级，理由是在财政纪律和经济增长的支持下，该国的财政和债务状况得到了 "有意义的 "改善。【原文：Costa Rica had its credit upgraded by Moody’s Ratings, citing the nation’s “meaningfully” improved fiscal and debt situation on the back of fiscal discipline and economic growth.】

item.title: 韩国称签证问题解决前美国项目仍将处于停滞状态
item.description: 韩国总理表示，在签证问题得到解决之前，韩国在美国的投资项目仍将处于停滞状态，他敦促华盛顿尽快采取行动，安抚那些担心因在美国工作而被拘留的韩国人。【原文：South Korea’s investment projects in the US will remain in limbo until visa issues are resolved, the nation’s prime minister said, urging Washington to act quickly to reassure Koreans concerned about getting detained for working there.】

item.title: 商界领袖呼吁解决病假问题
item.description: 商界领袖呼吁采取行动解决长期病患问题，并警告说这一问题正在 "玷污 "经济。【原文：Business leaders are calling for action to tackle long term sickness, warning the issue is "blighting" the economy】

item.title: 英国公司称补贴薪酬以应对青年病假危机
item.description: 一个著名的商业游说团体表示，英国应该为患病的年轻工人提供工资补贴，以帮助缓解正在阻碍经济发展的长期疾病危机。【原文：Britain should subsidize the wages of sick young workers to help ease a long-term illness crisis that is hobbling the economy, according to a prominent business lobby.】

item.title: 中国 "国家队 "基金从股票救市中获利 500 亿美元
item.description: 据彭博社（Bloomberg Intelligence）报道，中国主权财富基金的一个部门在购买本地交易所交易基金时获得了超过 500 亿美元的纸面收益，凸显了政府对中国股市的支持规模。【原文：A unit of China’s sovereign wealth fund has reaped paper gains of more than $50 billion buying local exchange-traded funds, highlighting the scale of government support for the country’s stock market, according to Bloomberg Intelligence.】

item.title: 高盛 "严重怀疑 "第一品牌将避免破产
item.description: 高盛集团交易台的分析师告诉客户，他们对汽车零部件供应商 First Brands 集团能否避免破产表示 "严重怀疑"。【原文：Analysts on a Goldman Sachs Group Inc. trading desk have told clients they have “serious doubts” that the auto-parts supplier First Brands Group will be able to avoid bankruptcy.】

item.title: 布拉斯凯姆公司与银行就续签 10 亿美元贷款进行谈判
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，布拉斯凯姆公司（Braskem SA）已开始与银团谈判，以续签将于明年年底到期的 10 亿美元无担保贷款。【原文：Braskem SA has kicked off talks with a syndicate of banks to renew a $1 billion unsecured facility that expires late next year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国将对机器人和医疗设备征收关税
item.description: 特朗普政府对机器人、工业机械和医疗设备的进口展开调查，为唐纳德-特朗普总统扩大关税制度、征收新关税创造了条件。【原文：The Trump administration launched investigations into imports of robotics, industrial machinery and medical devices, setting the stage for fresh duties as President Donald Trump moves to expand his tariff regime.】

item.title: 花旗银行以 23 亿美元向墨西哥商人出售 Banamex 股份
item.description: 花旗集团同意将其墨西哥零售银行部门 Banamex 25% 的股份出售给当地商人 Fernando Chico Pardo，作为该资产公开上市计划的一部分。【原文：Citigroup Inc. agreed to sell a 25% stake in its Mexican retail banking unit Banamex to local businessman Fernando Chico Pardo as part of a plan to list the asset publicly.】

item.title: 戴利称可能会进一步降息，但美联储应谨慎行事
item.description: 旧金山联邦储备银行行长玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）表示，可能需要进一步降息，但美国央行应谨慎行事。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President Mary Daly said further interest-rate cuts are likely needed, but the US central bank should approach those with caution.】

item.title: 银行发放 55 亿美元贷款，为 Dayforce 即将进行的收购提供资金支持
item.description: 以高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：A Goldman Sachs Group Inc.-led group of banks launched a $5.5 billion leveraged loan on Wednesday to help finance Thoma Bravo’s pending acquisition of human-resources software provider Dayforce Inc.】

item.title: 为什么说瑞典银行家是被围困的新西兰央行的解药？
item.description:
全球货币人才市场正在蓬勃发展。对新西兰来说，把目光投向海外是非常明智的选择。【原文：

There’s a burgeoning global market for monetary talent. It made perfect sense for New Zealand to look beyond its shores. 

】

item.title: 新西兰央行新行长可能在降息周期结束后上任
item.description: 到 12 月初安娜-布雷曼（Anna Breman）接任新西兰储备银行行长时，当前货币宽松周期的所有兴奋点可能都已结束。【原文：By the time Anna Breman takes over as governor of the Reserve Bank of New Zealand at the start of December, all the excitement over the current monetary easing cycle may be done.】

item.title: 特朗普的新 H-1B 费用会给谁带来损失—也许会带来好处—？
item.description:
在本期《特朗普经济学》中，我们将探讨美国工人和科技公司将如何受到 10 万美元开支的影响，以及印度可能出现的一线希望。【原文：

On this episode of Trumponomics, we look at how US workers and tech firms will be affected by the $100,000 expense, and a potential silver lining for India.

】

item.title: 英特尔寻求苹果投资作为其东山再起计划的一部分
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，英特尔公司已经与苹果公司进行了接触，商讨对这家濒临破产的芯片制造商进行投资的事宜。【原文：Intel Corp. has approached Apple Inc. about securing an investment in the ailing chipmaker, according to people familiar with the matter, part of efforts to bolster a business that’s now partially owned by the US government.】

item.title: 借贷成本持续下降，美国企业债券销售激增
item.description: 本月，从科技巨头到电力生产商，各家公司都将美国企业债券的销售额推向了历史最高水平，因为这些公司利用了借贷成本下降和投资者需求未被满足的机会。【原文：From tech behemoths to power producers, companies have pushed US corporate-bond sales to historically high levels this month as firms capitalize on falling borrowing costs and unquenched investor demand.】
